metadata.title: CVE-2020-36323 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, there is an optimization forjoining strings that can cause uninitialized bytes to be exposed (or theprogram to crash) if the borrowed string changes after its length ischecked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.61 - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-all - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-clippy - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-gdb - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-lldb - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rust-src - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rustc - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
rustfmt - 1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.61.0+dfsg1-1~exp1ubuntu1').
